comments.author: jeff_white@ncsu.edu
comments.creator: jeff_white@ncsu.edu
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110706 Firefox/5.0 SeaMonkey/2.2
Build ID: 20110706120824

Steps to reproduce:

Opened Password Manager


Actual results:

Can see passwords save, but see no "Passwords Never Saved" tab.


Expected results:

Help, and my recollection of prior versions, indicate that there should be a "Passwords Never Saved Tab."

comments.creator: leo.c@att.net
comments.author: leo.c@att.net
comments.raw_text:
I have the same problem with Sea Monkey on two machines, with variations in the operating system and the current version of Sea Monkey.  

First machine, Windows 7 Professional 64 bit Version 6.1 Build 7601 Service Pack 1

User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:18.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/18.0 SeaMonkey/2.15.1
Build identifier: 20130118191213

When I follow either of the options in Help get to Manage Passwords using either the Edit>Preferences or Tools>Password Manager paths, I get to the Data Manager screen.  The only tabs are the tabs for Cookies, Permissions, Preferences, and Passwords.  No "Passwords Never Saved" tab as indicated in Help.

Second machine:  Windows XP Professional 32 bit, Version 5.1, Build 2600.xpsp_sp3_gdr12081-1629:Service Pack 3
Same user agent and build identifier above except for thr part specifying the version of Windows.  Same behavior.

I wanted to remove a website from the Passwords Never Saved list, but there was no corresponding tab on either machine.

comments.author: RainerBielefeldNG@BielefeldUndBuss.de
comments.creator: RainerBielefeldNG@BielefeldUndBuss.de
comments.raw_text:
Well, in Help after search for "passwords" at hit "Managing Stored Passwords" under heading "Viewing and Managing Stored Passwords" I read in the paragraph below listing: "Click the Passwords Never Saved tab to see a list of the websites for which you instructed Password Manager never to store user names and passwords. "

a) So effect is REPRODUCIBLE with EN-US SeaMonkey 2.33.1 (German Language pack)  Gecko/20100101 Build 20150321194901 (Default Theme) on German WIN7 64bit 

b) Someone will have to find out whether Help or UI is wrong

c) currently I do not know how to instruct password manager 
   "never to store user names and passwords."

comments.author: RainerBielefeldNG@BielefeldUndBuss.de
comments.creator: RainerBielefeldNG@BielefeldUndBuss.de
comments.text:
this might be a serious problem. Steps how to reproduce:

1. In browser go to <https://acsiclubid.acsi.eu/>
2. click "log in"
3. Into appeared log in data view type username "x@y.de" and password "z"
   [login]
   » login process starts, PW-Manager message appears
4. In dropdown select "Never save passwords from this site"
   » PM-message disappears, login will have failed
5. Try again from 2
   As expeccted now in step 4 no Password Manager message will appear, it will
   be impossible to save passwords for this site.

a) bug what If you rcange your mind and want to save a password? I did not find 
   any possibility how to delete "never save" status
comments.raw_text:
this might be a serious problem. Steps how to reproduce:

1. In browser go to <https://acsiclubid.acsi.eu/>
2. click "log in"
3. Into appeared log in data view type username "x@y.de" and password "z"
   [login]
   » login process starts, PW-Manager message appears
4. In dropdown select "Never save passwords from this site"
   » PM-message disappears, login will have failed
5. Try again from 2
   As expeccted now in step 4 no Password Manager message will appear, it will
   be impossible to save passwords for this site.

a) bug what If you rcange your mind and want to save a password? I did not find 
   any possibility how to delete "never save" status

comments.text:
b) As expected with SM 2.0 Portable I was able to remove "acsiclubid.acsi.eu"
   from PM-TAB "Never Save ...", and afterwards PM again was active for that
   site.
c) very old regression
d) currently that seems serious to me, because I can not find out how to
   get PM back for a site what has been marked "never save ..."

comments.author: david@rossde.com
comments.creator: david@rossde.com
comments.text:
Windows 7
SeaMonkey 2.26.1

With the Password Exporter extension installed, I go to [Edit > Preferences > Privacy & Security > Passwords] and select the Import/Export Passwords button.  On the Import/Export Passwords popup, I select the View Saved Passwords button.  I get the old Passwords Manager window, which includes a Passwords Never Saved tab.  No, that does not solve this bug; but it does show that the necessary capability still exists somewhere in the Passwords Manager code.  

NOTE:  I am sticking with SeaMonkey 2.26.1 until saved passwords can
be used when autocomplete=off.  See
<https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=433238>.  Supposedly, this will be fixed with mozilla38.
comments.raw_text:
Windows 7
SeaMonkey 2.26.1

With the Password Exporter extension installed, I go to [Edit > Preferences > Privacy & Security > Passwords] and select the Import/Export Passwords button.  On the Import/Export Passwords popup, I select the View Saved Passwords button.  I get the old Passwords Manager window, which includes a Passwords Never Saved tab.  No, that does not solve this bug; but it does show that the necessary capability still exists somewhere in the Passwords Manager code.  

NOTE:  I am sticking with SeaMonkey 2.26.1 until saved passwords can
be used when autocomplete=off.  See
<https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=433238>.  Supposedly, this will be fixed with mozilla38.
